description.short_desc: Actions for working with ListView objects
Capture Items To a File specified (if not abs, then to test dir)
description.detailed_desc: Capture Items To a File specified (if not abs, then to test dir)

description.short_desc: File name (if not absolute, then to test dir)
description.detailed_desc: File name (if not absolute, then to test dir)

description.short_desc: Specify a character encoding to be used when saving data to a file. If it is not specified, the system default file encoding will be used. The encoding should be a valid string supported by Java; if it is not valid, the system default file encoding will be used instead.
Captures all the items in the list to ...\datapool\test\afile.txt
description.detailed_desc: Captures all the items in the list to ...\datapool\test\afile.txt

description.short_desc: Captures all the items in the list to ...\datapool\test\afile.txt
description.detailed_desc:
Captures all the items in the list to ...\datapool\test\afile.txt
Writing file with "UTF-8" encoding.

description.short_desc: Verifies a particular case-sensitive text item is selected
Case-sensitive text of node that will be verified selected
description.detailed_desc: TextValue should contain the case-sensitive text of the item expected to already be selected

description.short_desc: Verifies that "AParticularUserID" is selected in the ListView.
Verifies a particular case-sensitive text item is NOT selected.
Case-sensitive text of node that will be verified unselected
description.detailed_desc: TextValue should contain the case-sensitive text of the item that is expected NOT to be selected.

description.short_desc: Verifies that "AParticularUserID" is NOT selected in the ListView.
Routine to select (single click) an item according to its text value.
Case-sensitive text of node to select
description.detailed_desc: SelectTextValue should contain the case-sensitive text item to select.

description.short_desc: Optional index of the Nth duplicate item to match.
description.detailed_desc:
Allows us to match duplicate item N in a list containing duplicate entries. For example, match the 2nd (or specified Nth) item whose text matches the provided text value.
The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"

description.short_desc: Selects "AParticularUserID" from the ListView object
Selects the 2nd text item matching "AParticularUserID" from the ListView object
Routine to select (single click) an item according to a partial text match.
Case-sensitive substring of node to select
description.detailed_desc: PartialTextValue should be a case-sensitive substring of text item to select.

description.short_desc: Optional index of the Nth duplicate item to match.
description.detailed_desc:
Allows us to match duplicate item N in a list containing duplicate entries. For example, match the 2nd (or specified Nth) item whose text matches the provided text value.
The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"

description.short_desc: Selects the first item containing "APartialString" in the ListView.
Selects the 2nd text item containing "APartialString" in the ListView.
Single click a text item at specific Coords.
Case-sensitive text of node to select
description.detailed_desc: SelectTextValue should contain the case-sensitive text item to select.

description.short_desc: The explicit coordinates ("x,y") or an App Map reference to pre-defined coordinates.
description.detailed_desc:
We first check to see if the field contains a reference to an App Map item. If that cannot be found, we will assume the field contains explicit coordinates.
We expect the coordinates in the format "x,y":
[MyListView]
Center=5,120 OR
Center=Coords=5,120
The results from the lookup are appended to the "Coords=" string used by the Click command in Robot (if necessary).
Both Fields #3(component name) and #6(coords reference name) are used to locate the item in the App Map. This routine does not specify an App Map so only the current Map is used and it is expected to be valid.

description.short_desc: Optional index of the Nth duplicate item to match.
description.detailed_desc:
Allows us to match duplicate item N in a list containing duplicate entries. For example, match the 2nd (or specified Nth) item whose text matches the provided text value.
The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"

description.short_desc: Single Click "AParticularUserID" at specific coords.
Single Click the 2nd text item matching "AParticularUserID" at specific coords.
Single Click "AParticularUserID" at specific coords.
Single Click "AParticularUserID" at coords defined in the App Map in a [MyList] section.

detailed_desc.p: Both Fields #3(component name) and #6(coords reference name) are used to locate the item in the App Map. This routine does not specify an App Map so only the current Map is used and it is expected to be valid.

description.short_desc: Activate (double-click) an item based on it's index in the list
description.detailed_desc: It is important to note that some ListViews index their values differently. For example, you may need to select an item by text by using a property whose starting index is 1. Yet, if you request to seek an item strictly by index, the starting index is 0. So, the test developer may need to evaluate their ListView object for these differences.

description.short_desc: Index of the text item to select
description.detailed_desc: It is important to note that some ListViews index their values differently. For example, you may need to select an item by text by using a property whose starting index is 1. Yet, if you request to seek an item strictly by index, the starting index is 0. So, the test developer may need to evaluate their ListView object for these differences.

description.short_desc: Selects the item in the list at the specified index.
Same as (Alias for) ListView SelectIndexItem

Selects the item in the list at the provided index. (See ListView SelectIndexItem)

description.short_desc: Routine to randomly select multiple items in the ListView object.
description.detailed_desc: Routine to randomly select multiple items in the ListView object. Each selection is done with a CTRL + Single Left Click. Items are selected by index, not by their text values. Items already selected are NOT unselected. We add to existing selections.

description.short_desc: The quantity of items to randomly select in the object.
Randomly selects 3 items from the ListView object.

description.short_desc: Assigns the value of a cell in a listview to a variable.
Name of variable to assign value
description.detailed_desc: The variable name that should be used to hold the value retrieved by this command.

description.short_desc: The coordinate of the row in the listview that you want to capture the value.
description.detailed_desc: We will capture the row, column value in the listview and assign it to the variable value. First you identify the row and then the column.

description.short_desc: The coordinate of the column in the listview that you want to capture the value.
description.detailed_desc: We will capture the row, column value in the listview and assign it to the variable value. First you identify the row and then the column.

description.short_desc: Assigns the value in the 2nd row, 3rd column of the "MyList" listview to a variable named "variablename."

description.short_desc: Verify that a list view contains the provided item.
description.detailed_desc: The search of the item is expected to be a case-sensitive exact match of the item.

description.short_desc: The case-sensitive name of the item to verify.
description.detailed_desc: ItemText should contain the case-sensitive text item to find in the list view. A message is sent to the log confirming whether or not the item is found in the list view.

description.short_desc: Verify the item "AParticularServerName" is found in the ListView object.
Set a variable with the result of checking that a listview contains the provided item.
description.detailed_desc: The search of the item is expected to be a case-sensitive exact match of the item. The provided variable is set with 'TRUE' if the item is found or 'FALSE' if the item is not found.

description.short_desc: The case-sensitive name of the sought item.
description.detailed_desc: ItemText should contain the case-sensitive text item to find in the list view. A message is sent to the log confirming whether or not the item is found in the list view.

description.short_desc: The name of the variable receiving the result.
description.detailed_desc: This variable is set with 'TRUE' if the item is found or 'FALSE' if the item is not found.

short_desc.p: Variable isFound is set to 'TRUE' if the item "AParticularServerName" is found in the ListView object. If the item is not found, the variable isFound is set to 'FALSE'.

description.short_desc: Routine for multiple selection to Control+Click on an item by its text value.
description.detailed_desc: This adds selected items to items already selected.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of node to select.
Optional index of the Nth duplicate item to match.
description.detailed_desc:
Allows us to match duplicate item N in a list containing duplicate entries. For example, match the 2nd (or specified Nth) item whose text matches the provided text value.
The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"

description.short_desc: Ctrl+Clicks "AParticularUserID" from the ListView object.
description.detailed_desc: Ctrl+Clicks "AParticularUserID" from the ListView object. This adds to any existing items already selected.

description.short_desc: Ctrl+Clicks the 2th item matching "AParticularUserID" from the ListView object.
Routine for multiple selection to Control+Click on an item according to a partial text match.
description.detailed_desc: This adds selected items to items already selected.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive substring of text item to select.
Optional index of the Nth duplicate item to match.
description.detailed_desc:
Allows us to match duplicate item N in a list containing duplicate entries. For example, match the 2nd (or specified Nth) item whose text matches the provided text value.
The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"

description.short_desc: Ctrl+Clicks the first item containing "ASubstring" in the ListView.
description.detailed_desc: Ctrl+Clicks the first item containing "ASubstring" in the ListView. This adds to any existing items already selected.

description.short_desc: Ctrl+Clicks the 2th item containing "ASubstring" in the ListView.
Routine to Shift+Click and Verify a selection according to its text value.
description.detailed_desc:
This extends the current selection to include the specified selection and all other items inbetween.
NOTE: This may not work in all environments (Java, Web, etc...)

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of node to select and verify.
Selects "AParticularUserID" from the ListView object with Shfit key pressedd down.
description.detailed_desc:
Selects "AParticularUserID" from the ListView object with Shfit key pressedd down. This adds "AParticularUserID" and any items inbetween to any existing items already selected.
When possible, we will also attempt to verify the added selection was successful.
